result.execSummary:
The defendant John A Cicero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for work.
Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on 06-08-2022.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 06-08-2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
No possession of firearms. Defendant is not eligible to have the firearm from this incident returned.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John A Cicero

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John A Cicero in court with attorney Basil Martin Loeb.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. Defense filed a bail/bond form. Defense requests that the $650.00 cash bail that was previously posted on 03/01/2022 to be returned to the remittur as is should have been stated on the 03/01/2022 appearance. Court orders the $650.00 cash bail posted to be returned to the remittur. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
 
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on 06/08/2022.  
-No possession of firearms. Defendant is not eligible to have the firearm from this incident returned. 
-No contact with JMC.

-Pay ALL costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 06/08/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
At the request of the Court, case is rescheduled. Parties notified.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant John A Cicero in court with attorney Basil Martin Loeb.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John A Cicero appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel has discovery and requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John A Cicero in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant John A Cicero in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John A Cicero appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
